definition:
A sequence $(s_n)$ is *monotonically decreasing* if

$$s_m < s_n \;\forall\; m > n$$

Similarly, a real function $f(x)$ is monotonically decreasing if

$$f(x) < f(y) \;\forall\; x > y$$

Compare this to monotonically nonincreasing.

**Conflict note.** In other context, such as [@NIST], this is called
*strictly decreasing*. When this is the case, “monotonically
nonincreasing” is instead called “monotonically decreasing.”
